definition: to get in hand/to get (one's) hands on/to get hold of (in the sense of to acquire)
lane/alley
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
variant of 弄[long4]
old variant of 弄[nong4]
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: At that time, passports were not easily laid hold of.
sentences.chinese: 当时，护照是不容易弄到手的。

sentences.english: The book is out of print and difficult to procure.
sentences.chinese: 那书已绝版，很难弄到手。

sentences.english: I'll make her by all means.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎样我要将她弄到手。

sentences.english: What money he could lay his hands on he spent like anIndian rajah.
sentences.chinese: 凡是能弄到手的钱，他花起来象一位印度王子。

sentences.english: I hesitated whether to attempt to secure the photograph at once.
sentences.chinese: 我曾犹豫是否应该试着把那张照片马上弄到手。

sentences.english: I can never get a girl like that with conventional methods.
sentences.chinese: 按常规办法，我永远都不会将这样的一个女孩弄到手。

sentences.english: Get your hands on some good books about security and read them.
sentences.chinese: 把一些关于安全的好书弄到手并阅读。

sentences.english: When her uncle died, she grabbed everything she could get her hands on.
sentences.chinese: 她的叔叔死后，她把能弄到手的东西全部都据为己有。

sentences.english: A journalist has tried to muscle in on my exclusive story.
sentences.chinese: 一个记者一直想强行把我的独家报道弄到手。

definition: to get hold of/to obtain/to secure/to come by
to take possession of/to get hold of
to subdue/to force to capitulate/to reduce to submission/to soothe
to make uniform/to even up/to make good a deficiency
to take for one's own/to expropriate
to persuade
to be fair/to be impartial/to settle (a matter etc)
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
to eliminate
to kill/to put to death
to get rid of
to take away
treasure/CL:件[jian4]
to hog/to keep everything for oneself
to retrieve
to accomplish/to get sth done
